title_sort: john j. barker to walt whitman, 19 june 1863
title: John J. Barker to Walt Whitman, 19 June 1863
text: Dear friendi resevd[received] your leter[letter] this morning an was very glad to here from you i[I] am driven a team for the regment[regiment] i[I] have every faver[Favor] i[I] ask. i[I] go whare[where] i[I] pleas[please] and when i[I] pleas[please] Capten[Captain] sais[says] he will do all in his power to get mee[me] in as a recruten[recruiting] officer if i[I] get that i[I] will be just whare[where] i[I] want to bee[be] Carter is the Col he is all the man that hoald[hold] the same command that they first held thar[there] has bin a change in all the officers in the regment[regiment] lutennent[Lieutenant] Col melten[Melton] is in command of the regment[regiment] Col Carter is often brgider genral[general] genral[general] Carter is ctin mager[major] general wee think they will be promoted Capten Skaggs did may the 19 at stan-foard[Stanford] by A Psenter that was ordley[orderly] sargent[sergeant] of Co E is now Captan[Captain] he is Jest like a privet and as study as a Jug JC sebrig is fist lutenent[lieutenant] B B Jones is a lutenent[lieutenant] brother william[William] is ordly[orderly]I hve[have] got sound an well an as stout as ever i[I] have bin[been] at home twice since i[I] roat[wrote] to you i[I] cudent[couldn't] stay long for the rebels pickets was in site just acrous[across] the river an our pickets on this side i[I] wish you could be with mee[me] i[I] have moar[more] fun than a litel[little] i[I] am singel[single] all a long the road from mill springs to stanfoard[Stanford] whare[where] i[I] make a trip ever 7 or 8 days i[I] go in two miles of hoam[home] when i[I] go to millsprings our boys are all in good sirrets and egger to fight since rot to you wee[we] went acrous[across] the river an had skermis[skermish] of about 4 ours an driv[drive] the bac[back] seven miles wee[we] returned in good order our los[loss] was 6 kild[killed] an 30 wound Capten Carrens morrtly[mortally] I but is geten beter lutenen will Coff wounded 5 companys[companies] of our regmet[regiment] is at millsprings an 5 here they will return today they 70 prisners[prisoners] yesterd[yesterday] give my big respc[respect] to all inquiren[inquiring] friends tell mis isral[Israel] an mis low howdy for me ma[my] god bles[bless] you good by John J. Barker to Walt Whitman, 19 June 1863
